Definition: Customers whose predicted profit is in the bottom third of all customers.
Business Logic: If a customer’s predicted profit (CLTV) is less than the 33rd percentile of all customers, they are classified as Low CLTV.
Business Interpretation: These customers are less likely to generate significant long-term profit. They may buy infrequently or spend very little.
Recommended Actions: Limit retention investment. Use low-cost, automated communication channels.
Marketing Strategy: Implement highly automated, low-cost email or SMS campaigns focused on driving a single, quick repeat purchase or engagement, leveraging basic segmentation and generic discount offers to minimize marketing spend per customer.
System Activation: Used to suppress high-cost acquisition/retention efforts. May be included in A/B tests for upsell tactics.

Definition: Customers whose predicted profit falls between the 33rd and 66th percentile.
Business Logic: If a customer’s predicted profit (CLTV) is between the 33rd and 66th percentile, they are classified as Medium CLTV.
Business Interpretation: These customers have average value. They may be occasional buyers who could grow into loyal customers.
Recommended Actions: Nurture with value-driven offers. Monitor behavior for signs of churn or growth.
Marketing Strategy: Use targeted promotions or personalized recommendations to increase spending.
System Activation: Used in lifecycle marketing and retention optimization campaigns.

Definition: Customers whose predicted profit is in the top third of all customers.
Business Logic: If a customer’s predicted profit (CLTV) is greater than or equal to the 66th percentile, they are classified as High CLTV.
Business Interpretation: These are your most valuable customers. They purchase frequently, spend a lot, and are worth retaining.
Recommended Actions: Invest in loyalty, exclusivity, and high-touch service. Prevent churn proactively.
Marketing Strategy: Exclusive deals, early access, loyalty points, or personalized communication to reinforce engagement.
System Activation: Used in VIP programs, loyalty journeys, retention dashboards, and CAC modeling.
